medical_history.chief_complaint: Dyspnea, hypoxemia, and the presence of infiltrates in both lungs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Fatigue, progressive dyspnea, and diffuse myalgias occurred seven days before admission after a 2-day summer camping trip, followed by chills, nasal congestion, rhinorrhea, rigors, and fever (38.7Â°C). Symptoms progressively worsened, with marked hypoxemia (oxygen saturation of 85% while breathing ambient air).
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of leukemia, double-unit cord-blood transplantation, respiratory failure requiring mechanical ventilation, acute kidney injury, duodenal graft-versus-host disease (GVHD), catheter-associated thrombus of the right subclavian vein, and previous cesarean section.
medical_history.family_history: Father had melanoma, and paternal grandfather had rheumatoid arthritis. No other family history of cancer mentioned.
medical_history.social_history: Works in a hair salon, lives with her son, drinks alcohol socially. Smoked cigarettes for 3 years in the past, does not use illicit drugs.
